_header: Today in the dawning I heard the fowls sing
_description: The names of birds — five long-line couplets, with sporadic medial rhyme

BLHar1002.First Lines:
Today in the dawnyng I hyrde þe fowles syngThe names of hem it
                    likyt me to myng The parterygg the fesant and þe sterlyngThe
                    quayle & þe goldefyng and þe lapwyng…
BLHar1002.Last Lines:
…Among all þe fowles þat maden glethe rere mowse and
                    þe owle cowde I not see
BLHar1002.Editions:
Wright,  Cyril Ernest. 
             “Late Middle English Parerga in a School Collection.” 
             Review of English Studies
         n.s. 2 (1951): 114-20: 116.
